title: "Two Sample Hypothesis Testing"
output: html_document
date: "2024-08-20"

```{r}
# Parameters
alpha <- 0.01
n <- 20
delta_mu <- 1
sigma <- 2.0

# Calculate the effect size
effect_size <- delta_mu / (sigma / sqrt(n))

# Calculate power using the pwr library
# Install the pwr package if you haven't already by running install.packages("pwr")
library(pwr)
power_result <- pwr.t.test(n = n, d = effect_size, sig.level = alpha, type = "one.sample", alternative = "two.sided")

# Print the power rounded to 4 decimal places
round(power_result$power, 4)

```

```{r}
# Parameters
alpha <- 0.01
beta <- 0.05
delta_mu <- 1
sigma <- 2.0

# Find the z-values for the significance level and power
z_alpha <- qnorm(1 - alpha / 2)  # Two-tailed test
z_beta <- qnorm(1 - beta)

# Calculate the minimum sample size
n <- ((z_alpha + z_beta) * sigma / delta_mu)^2

# Round up to the next whole number
ceiling(n)

```









```{r}
# Step 1: Load the data
# Assuming the data is in a CSV format
tool_life_data <- read.table("ToolLife.dat", header = TRUE)

# Step 2: Explore the data
summary(tool_life_data)

# Check the structure of the data
str(tool_life_data)

# Step 3: Conduct a Two-Sample T-Test
# Assuming the data has a column 'Life' for cutting life and a column 'Vendor' for vendor label
t_test_result <- t.test(life ~ vendor, data = tool_life_data)

# Step 4: Output the test results
print(t_test_result)

# Determine which vendor has a higher mean
mean_by_vendor <- aggregate(life ~ vendor, data = tool_life_data, mean)
print(mean_by_vendor)

```


```{r}
# Calculate the variance for each vendor
variance_by_vendor <- aggregate(life ~ vendor, data = tool_life_data, var)

# Print the variances for each vendor
print(variance_by_vendor)

```

```{r}
# Load the data
data <- read.table("Straight.dat", header = TRUE)

str(data)

# Conduct a paired t-test
result <- t.test(data$before, data$after, paired = TRUE)

# Output the t-statistic to four decimal places
t_statistic <- round(result$statistic, 4)
t_statistic


```

```{r}
# Conduct a paired t-test
result <- t.test(data$before, data$after, paired = TRUE)

# Output the t-statistic and p-value
t_statistic <- round(result$statistic, 4)
p_value <- result$p.value

# Print the results
t_statistic
p_value

```

```{r}
# Input data
before <- c(0.016, 0.014, 0.008, 0.013, 0.019, 0.027, 0.017, 0.020, 0.017, 0.018,
            0.016, 0.011, 0.019, 0.014, 0.023, 0.020, 0.019, 0.016, 0.017, 0.022)

after <- c(0.009, 0.011, 0.006, 0.010, 0.014, 0.016, 0.010, 0.012, 0.013, 0.008,
           0.007, 0.006, 0.010, 0.007, 0.011, 0.010, 0.015, 0.004, 0.008, 0.014)

# Calculate the variances
var_before <- var(before)
var_after <- var(after)

# Calculate the F-test statistic
f_statistic <- var_before / var_after

# Print the F-statistic rounded to 4 decimal places
round(f_statistic, 4)

```

```{r}
# Input data
before <- c(0.016, 0.014, 0.008, 0.013, 0.019, 0.027, 0.017, 0.020, 0.017, 0.018,
            0.016, 0.011, 0.019, 0.014, 0.023, 0.020, 0.019, 0.016, 0.017, 0.022)

after <- c(0.009, 0.011, 0.006, 0.010, 0.014, 0.016, 0.010, 0.012, 0.013, 0.008,
           0.007, 0.006, 0.010, 0.007, 0.011, 0.010, 0.015, 0.004, 0.008, 0.014)

# Perform paired t-test
t_test_result <- t.test(before, after, paired = TRUE)

# Extract and print the t-test statistic rounded to 4 decimal places
round(t_test_result$statistic, 4)

```


```{r}
p1 <- 0.054
p2 <- 0.036
n1 <- 500
n2 <- 500

# Pooled proportion
p_pool <- (p1 * n1 + p2 * n2) / (n1 + n2)

# Test statistic
z <- (p1 - p2) / sqrt(p_pool * (1 - p_pool) * (1/n1 + 1/n2))

# p-value for the two-tailed test
p_value <- 2 * pnorm(-abs(z))
p_value

```

```{r}
lambda1 <- 7.5
lambda2 <- 10
n1 <- 2
n2 <- 1

# Z-test statistic
Z <- (lambda1 - lambda2) / sqrt((lambda1 / n1) + (lambda2 / n2))

# p-value calculation
p_value <- pnorm(Z)
p_value

```
